Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mental Health Intervention in Trauma Centers

Intervention.evidence: mental health intervention (n=85) or enhanced usual care control (n=86)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of a mental health intervention on healthcare utilization and cost savings.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was emergency department/inpatient utilization over 5 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomized to a mental health intervention (n=85) or enhanced usual care control (n=86)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intervention patients showed significant reductions in utilization compared to controls (F [19,3210] =2.23, P =0.009), with the greatest reductions at 3-6 months (15.5% vs. 26.7%, RR = 0.58, 95% CI 0.34, 1.00) and 12-15 months (16.5% vs. 30.6%, RR = 0.54, 95% CI 0.32, 0.91).
